titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Hannan, Indictment
CWG10425

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Bourbon Circuit Court
April term 1861
Commonwealth of Ky Plff
agt } Indictment giving liquor to a Slave
William Hannan Deft

The parties appeared by their attorney and the defendant pleads that he is not guilty of the offence charged in the indictment & thereupon the following Jurors, J, A, Howerton, James, M, Fisher, J. T. McClure John, L, Heckman, M, Hildreth, N, Talbott, J, H, Hutchcraft, B, E, Knapp, W W Fisher Thomas Kennedy James, E, Ford, and Wm, B, Sparks, were Sworn to try the issue & having heard the evidence returned the following verdict, "We of the Jury find the deft guilty" W W Fisher
It is therefore adjudged by the court that the Deft make his fine to the commonwealth by the payment of fifty dollars the fine imposed by law for the offence aforesaid, and the costs herein expended

A copy
Att James Paton C B C C
By John G Paton D C

Bourbon Cir Ct
$50 } giving liquor to a slave

Commonwealth
agt } Co Judgt
Wm Hannan
